revised_title: Developmental Stages and External Features of Lepidosiren paradoxa
tldr: The authors study the external features and developmental stages of the fish species Lepidosiren paradoxa. They describe the egg, gastrulation, and the larval stage, which is tadpole-shaped and lacks dark pigment. The authors also discuss the evolution of external gills and the possible origin of the vertebrate limb.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate Development
